value.ai_summary: TexEcon is a sophisticated static React application designed for comprehensive economic analysis of Texas, leveraging modern web development technologies and advanced static site generation techniques. The project utilizes React 19, TypeScript, and Vite to create a high-performance, SEO-optimized platform that dynamically fetches and renders economic content from a headless CMS (WebSpark) during the build process. Its architectural approach emphasizes progressive enhancement, with features like build-time content management, static site generation, and a robust deployment pipeline that automatically publishes to GitHub Pages with custom domain support. The application distinguishes itself through its sophisticated build process, which includes automated content fetching, sitemap generation, type safety, and comprehensive performance optimization techniques like code splitting, asset versioning, and efficient caching strategies. Tailwind CSS, Radix UI, and advanced routing with Wouter provide a responsive, accessible, and performant user interface for economic researchers, analysts, and stakeholders interested in Texas economic insights. The project represents a cutting-edge approach to static site development, combining modern web technologies with a focus on developer experience, performance, and content management.
